attributes.text: This is the base class for all mobile widgets.
When the widget gets active (receives keyboard events etc.)
Fired after the widget appears on the screen.
Fired before the context menu is opened.
The event is fired when the widget gets blurred.
Fired on change of the property {@link #enabled}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #id}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #visibility}.
Widget is clicked using left or middle button. {@link qx.event.type.Mouse#getButton} for more details.
Widget is clicked using the right mouse button.
Widget is double clicked using left or middle button. {@link qx.event.type.Mouse#getButton} for more details.
When the widget gets inactive
Fired after the widget disappears from the screen.
Fired after a massive DOM manipulation, e.g. when DOM elements were added or styles were changed. Listen to this event, if you need to recalculate a layout or have to update your view.
The event is fired when the widget gets focused.
When the widget itself or any child of the widget receive the focus.
When the widget itself or any child of the widget lost the focus.
This event if fired if a keyboard key is pressed down. This event is only fired once if the user keeps the key pressed for a while.

This event is fired if the pressed key or keys result in a printable character. Since the character is not necessarily associated with a single physical key press, the event does not have a key identifier getter. This event gets repeated if the user keeps pressing the key(s).

The unicode code of the pressed key can be read using {@link qx.event.type.KeyInput#getCharCode}.
This event is fired any time a key is pressed. It will be repeated if the user keeps the key pressed. The pressed key can be determined using {@link qx.event.type.KeySequence#getKeyIdentifier}.
This event if fired if a keyboard key is released.
Fired when a finger holds on the screen.
Mouse button is pressed on the widget.
Fired if the mouse cursor moves over the widget.
Fired if the mouse cursor leaves widget.
Fired if the mouse cursor enters the widget.
Mouse button is released on the widget.
Fired if the mouse wheel is used over the widget.
Fired when two pointers performing a pinch in/out gesture on the screen.
Fired when an active pointer moves on the screen or the mouse wheel is used.
Fired when two pointers performing a rotate gesture on the screen.
Fired when a finger swipes over the screen.
Fired when a finger taps on the screen.
Fired if a touch at the screen is canceled.
Fired if a touch at the screen has ended.
Fired during a touch at the screen.
Fired if a touch at the screen is started.
Fired when an active pointer moves on the screen (after pointerdown till pointerup).
The causing action that triggered the layout update.
The animation properties to set. Key / value pairs.
Sets the visibility of the widget.
the widget to add.
Optional layout data for widget.
Adds a new child widget.
The widget to add.
Widget, after which the new widget will be inserted.
Optional layout data for widget.
Add a widget after another already inserted widget.
widget to add
Index, at which the widget will be inserted. If no widget exists at the given index, the new widget gets appended to the current list of children.
Optional layout data for widget.
Add a child widget at the specified index
widget to add
widget before the new widget will be inserted.
Optional layout data for widget.
Add a widget before another already inserted widget
The set value
The old value
The property name

Shortcut for each property that should change a certain attribute of the container element. Use the {@link #addAttributeMapping} method to add a property to attribute mapping when the attribute name or value differs from the property name or value.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property defaultCssClass.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultCssClass}.
, the new value of the widget
, the old value of the widget
Sets the enable property to the new value
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property id.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #id}.

Shortcut for each property that should change a certain style of the container element. Use the {@link #addStyleMapping} method to add a property to style mapping when the style name or value differs from the property name or value.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property visibility.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #visibility}.
Creates the container DOM element of the widget. Override this method if you want to create a custom widget.
the container element.
Triggers the {@link #scheduleDomUpdated} method. This method needs to be called when the DOM has changed, e.g. an element was added / removed / styled.
The attribute name
Returns the set value of the given attribute.
The attribute’s value
Returns the children of the widget.
The children of the widget

Returns the content DOM element of the widget. Override this method, to define another element as the content element.

Note: Most times this element points to to the container element. When the widget has a more complex element structure, the function should return a reference of the element that should contain the content.
the content DOM element of the widget
Returns the set layout manager for the widget.
the layout manager of the widget.
The style name of which the value should be returned
Returns the value of a certain style of the container element.
The value of the style
Returns the tag name of the container element of this widget. Override this method if you want to create a custom widget.
The container element’s tag name
Whether the widget has child widgets.
Whether the widget has children or not.
the widget to query for
Returns the index position of the given widget if it is a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1.
The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.
The child widget
Optional layout data for widget
Initializes the layout of the given child widget.
The widget to remove.
Removes a given child from the widget.
Removes all children from the widget.
An Array including the removed children.
Index of the widget to remove.
Remove the widget at the specified index.
The attribute name.
The attribute value. Null will reset the attribute.
Sets an attribute with the given value of the container element. The null value resets the attribute.
The container DOM element of the widget
Sets the container DOM element of the widget.
The html to set in the content element.
Sets the innerHTML of the content element and calls the {@link #_domUpdated} method.
The new layout or null to reset the layout.
Set a layout manager for the widget. A layout manager can only be connected with one widget. Reset the connection with a previous widget first, if you like to use it in another widget instead.
The style of which the value should be set
The value of the style. Null will reset the attribute.
Sets the value of a certain style of the container element. The null value resets the attribute.
Transforms this widget (rotate, scale, translate3d)
The set id of the widget
Transforms the value of the ID property. When the value is null, an auto generated ID is set. This makes sure that an ID is always set.
The transformed ID
The CSS class to add
Adds a CSS class to the container element of the widget. Use this method to enhance the default appearance of the widget.
The CSS classes to add, wrapped by an array.
Adds an array of CSS classes to the container element of the widget. Use this method to enhance the default appearance of the widget.
Removes this widget from its parent and disposes it.
The animation properties to set. Key / value pairs.
Hide this widget and exclude it from the underlying layout.

Returns the (computed) value of the property activatable.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activatable}.

The CSS class to check
Checks if the widget has a certain CSS class set.
Whether the CSS class is set or not
The animation properties to set. Key / value pairs.
Hide this widget.
Initial value for property activatable.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property activatable with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activatable}.
the default value
Initial value for property anonymous.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property anonymous with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property activatable equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activatable}.
Whether the property equals true.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property anonymous equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #anonymous}.
Whether the property equals true.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property enabled equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #enabled}.
Whether the property equals true.

Whether the widget is locally excluded.

Note: This method does not respect the hierarchy.
Returns true when the widget is excluded

Whether the widget is locally hidden.

Note: This method does not respect the hierarchy.
Returns true when the widget is hidden

Detects if the widget and all its parents are visible.

Warning: forces rendering of the browser. Do not use this method during animations or performance critical tasks.
trueif the widget is seeable

Whether the widget is locally visible.

Note: This method does not respect the hierarchy.
Returns true when the widget is visible
The widget to remove
Internal method. Removes a given child widget and the corresponding DOM element.
The CSS class to remove
Removes a CSS class from the container element of the widget.
The CSS classes to remove from widget.
Removes an array of CSS classes from the container element of the widget.

Resets the user value of the property activatable.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activatable}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property activatable.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activatable}.
the new value

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property anonymous.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #anonymous}.
the new value
The CSS class to toggle
Toggles the given CSS. Adds or removes the CSS class from the container element of the widget.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property enabled.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #enabled}.
the new value
The target widget
The causing action that triggered the layout update.
The animation properties to set. Key / value pairs.
Updates the layout with the given arguments.
The widget that should be updated
Incoming layout property data
Updates the layout properties of a given widget.
Whether the widget can be activated or not. When the widget is activated a css class active is automatically added to the widget, which can indicate the activation status.
Whether the widget should be the target of an event. Set this property to false when the widget is a child of another widget and shouldn’t react on events.

The default CSS class used for this widget. The default CSS class should contain the common appearance of the widget. It is set to the container element of the widget. Use {@link #addCssClass} to enhance the default appearance of the widget.
Whether this widget is enabled or not
The ID of the widget. When the ID is set to null an auto id will be generated.
The name attribute of the container element. Useful when you want to find an element by its name attribute.
Rotates the widget. Negative and positive values are allowed.
Scales the widget in X direction (width).
Scales the widget in Y direction (height).
This property controls whether the transformation uses the length unit px or rem. This feature is important for creating a resolution independent transformation.
Moves the widget on X axis.
Moves the widget on Y axis.
Moves the widget on Z axis.

Controls the visibility. Valid values are:

  • visible: Render the widget
  • hidden: Hide the widget. The space will be still available.
  • excluded: Hide the widget. The space will be released.
Mapping of attribute properties to their real attribute name.

Fires the DOM updated event directly. Triggers the {@link qx.event.handler.Appear#refresh} and {@link qx.ui.mobile.core.DomUpdatedHandler#refresh} methods. Do not use this method during massive DOM manipulations. Use {@link #scheduleDomUpdated} instead.
Incremental counter of the current id
Internal data structure to store widgets
ID of the timeout for the DOM update
Prefix for the auto id
Mapping of style properties to their real style name.
The property name
The real attribute name
Values of the property to the real attribute value. Use null, when you want not to set the attribute.

Adds an attribute mapping entry. This entry is used by the {@link #_applyAttribute} method. Shortcut when the property name differs from the real attribute name. Use this method if you want to add an attribute entry to the mapping from the defer function of a different widget.

e.g.: “selectable” : { attribute : “data-selectable”, values : { “true” : null, “false” : “false” } }
The property name
The real style name
Values of the property to the real style value. Use null, when you want not to set the style.

Adds a style mapping entry. This entry is used by the {@link #_applyStyle} method. Shortcut when the property name differs from the real style name. Use this method if you want to add a style entry to the mapping from the defer function of a different widget.

e.g.: “anonymous” : { style : “pointer-events”, values : { “true” : “none”, “false” : null } }
Returns the current widget id of the registry.
The current id
The id of the widget
Returns the widget with the given id.
The widget with the given id
Event handler. Called when the application is in shutdown.
The widget to register
Registers a widget with its id for internal widget handling.
Schedules the {@link #domUpdated} method. The method will be called after a timeout to prevent the triggered events to be fired too often, during massive DOM manipulations.
The id of the widget to unregister
Unregisters the widget with the given id.
